titlepage.titleproper: Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank Account Books, 1916-1927
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms2010-056

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank Account Books, 1916-1927
did.abstract: The account books are a record of newspaper deliveries in the area of Vinton, Virginia. An additional folder includes clippings and notes found between the pages compiled by Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank Account Books must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank Account Books, Ms2010-056, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The first Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank Account Book was purchased by Special Collections in March 2010. An additional account book was purchased in July 2014.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the first Mrs. C. D. [Minnie Linwood] Eubank Account Book commenced and was completed in July 2010. Additional processing and description was completed in July 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Mrs. C. D. Eubank is most likely Minnie Linwood Fox (James) Eubank. She was born about 1862 in Vinton, Virginia. In 1878, she married a saddler named Matson James. In 1892, she married Dr. Charles D. Eubank. She died in Virginia in 1938.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The account books are a record of newspaper deliveries in the area of Vinton, Virginia. The Vinton World News is delivered among others, specifically the "Times" (most likely the Roanoke Times). Each line designates the subscriber to the newspaper, the date range of their subscription, and the amount they are charged. There are also notes for either which newspaper they are receiving or where the subscriber resides.
An additional folder includes clippings and notes found between the pages of the book. Some clippings are of Mrs. Eubank's of classified ad listings. Notes are regarding payment collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Dr. Charles D. Eubank Memoranda Books, 1909, 1911-1916. Ms2009-108. Finding aid available on the Virginia Heritage database.
